intro: Bunium simplex, commonly known as the simple fennel, is a member of the Apiaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Central Asia and parts of the Middle East. The plant features slender, hollow stems and finely divided, feathery leaves. Its small yellow flowers are arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Bunium simplex is often found in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils.
